commit_message:
Add bench-requirements.txt to tox venv

In order to generate docs Sphinx has to import all python modules
in the codebase. Because of that, the bench-requirements dependencies
are needed to build the API reference section in the developers guide.

commit_message:
Fix openSUSE kernel/initrd detection

For some of the scripts, the unversioned name is not
good enough. so determine the link target of "vmlinuz" and
"initrd" to get the full versioned path.

Change-Id: I52f9b5435fafaf7925e2332058a9e41b26478f1c

in undercloud and overcloud, VMs may run out of memory quite often.

Change-Id: Ib68a5d542620fadd2b93b87bf8b59115f4d7423c
'}]
commit_message:
Increase default RAM for 32bit to 2.5G

After merging patches which include pacemaker and corosync services
in undercloud and overcloud, VMs may run out of memory quite often.
Increasing default memory to 2.5G should make situation more stable.

Change-Id: Ib68a5d542620fadd2b93b87bf8b59115f4d7423c

subject: Log stdout, stderr and command on execute() error
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-09-03 02:23:55.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_processutils.py', 'oslo/concurrency/processutils.py'], 'message': "Log stdout, stderr and command on execute() error

It would help debugging considerably if a failure in execute()
generated a message (at a client specified logging level). Such a
message, generated by execute() would only occur if the user requested
it by specifying a parameter (log_errors), and execute() were to throw
an exception. As an example, this change would address the issue being
addressed in bug 1340124 for the Trove project only.

DocImpact: New parameter added to processutils.execute().  The
possible values of the log_errors parameter are 'all' or 'final'. The
default value of None implies no logging. If it is set to 'final',
stdout and stderr are logged on the final failure. If it is set to
'all', stdout and stderr are logged on every failure.

Originally-submitted-in: If8180e042e1a05374ef705f5873cc0981243619f

Change-Id: Id9e94bd8d009b8f134f0b681da5dec5717d662ff
DocImpact:
Closes-Bug: #1342857
Suggested-By: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>
Reported-By: Ionuț Arțăriși <iartarisi@suse.cz>
"}]
commit_message:
Log stdout, stderr and command on execute() error

It would help debugging considerably if a failure in execute()
generated a message (at a client specified logging level). Such a
message, generated by execute() would only occur if the user requested
it by specifying a parameter (log_errors), and execute() were to throw
an exception. As an example, this change would address the issue being
addressed in bug 1340124 for the Trove project only.

DocImpact: New parameter added to processutils.execute().  The
possible values of the log_errors parameter are 'all' or 'final'. The
default value of None implies no logging. If it is set to 'final',
stdout and stderr are logged on the final failure. If it is set to
'all', stdout and stderr are logged on every failure.

Originally-submitted-in: If8180e042e1a05374ef705f5873cc0981243619f

Change-Id: Id9e94bd8d009b8f134f0b681da5dec5717d662ff
DocImpact:
Closes-Bug: #1342857
Suggested-By: Peter Stachowski <peter@tesora.com>
Reported-By: Ionuț Arțăriși <iartarisi@suse.cz>

If a create project request is sent to keystone with no enabled field set,
the default behavior should be to set enabled to True for the new project,
but because we are passing the wrong variable to the driver creation
method, this new project end up with the enabled field set to "nothing".

Change-Id: I9ebfdde03c0f25cadd1323de9863a230d8058f4e
(cherry picked from commit 22301d95142a30e9ec7fb1bde47dc0d0b4eabd9d)

commit_message:
Fix variable passed to driver module

If a create project request is sent to keystone with no enabled field set,
the default behavior should be to set enabled to True for the new project,
but because we are passing the wrong variable to the driver creation
method, this new project end up with the enabled field set to "nothing".

Closes-Bug: #1261976
Change-Id: I9ebfdde03c0f25cadd1323de9863a230d8058f4e
(cherry picked from commit 22301d95142a30e9ec7fb1bde47dc0d0b4eabd9d)

This part fixes ironic/common folder and tox.ini file.

Some modules use _ function for log translation, even when the
translated string is passed to e.g. LOG.warn function. This patch
fixes it, using translator functions appropriate for corresponding
log levels. Translator functions, imported from
ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils are now imported from
ironic.common.i18n. Translator functions are imported the same way

Change-Id: I195d0e256c5412d6d75d2e6c35b19b44f2a0b09f
'}]
commit_message:
Translator functions cleanup part 1

This part fixes ironic/common folder and tox.ini file.

Some modules use _ function for log translation, even when the
translated string is passed to e.g. LOG.warn function. This patch
fixes it, using translator functions appropriate for corresponding
log levels. Translator functions, imported from
ironic.openstack.common.gettextutils are now imported from
ironic.common.i18n. Translator functions are imported the same way
across all modules. All places that are changed conform to
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html

Partial-bug: #1364813

Change-Id: I195d0e256c5412d6d75d2e6c35b19b44f2a0b09f

commit_message:
Add serializers to scheduler call

 * For some purposes, we should able to pass typed
   object as one of method arguments to Scheduler.
   For doing that, we pass serializer for this argument -
   it will be serialized during save to the DB and
   will be deserialized during delayed method call.

Change-Id: I5b4f4f3638d09888b331c29bba9c095163d62288

commit_message:
tests/service: consolidate setUp/tearDown logic

Consolidate the duplicate code for extension api tests.
This will be also used by servicevm extensions later.

At the same time, a bug in test_extension_firewall.py is also fixed.
double call of super().setUp().

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/services/loadbalancer/test_loadbalancer_plugin.py

Additional changes:
- test_extension_firewall.py: removed unused 'webtest' import

Closes-bug: #1275654
Change-Id: I72f185ef6e5af55729ced51fc0b72fae799d46ac
(cherry picked from commit fdbaba877f98bf20c1ff71c9bd0d04956120f845)

Pin testtools version to < 0.9.36

New testtools require that setUp() is not called twice, and we have
multiple projects that do that. So pin the version for now until we
clear the mess.

Change-Id: I7bbb59534382c9fe39789bbf7d12e14bba41aec0

This avoids resetting the channel where there are no consumers. For
publishing there is no real state associated with the channel so
reusing is fine. Connections tend to be used for one or other of

'}]
commit_message:
Possible performance optimisation for publish

This avoids resetting the channel where there are no consumers. For
publishing there is no real state associated with the channel so
reusing is fine. Connections tend to be used for one or other of
sending or receiving, so this seems like a simple yet potentially
effective patch.

Change-Id: I297212f1ca7babd127ae33cc7a62bbe23cb70242

subject: Fix tests with testtools>=0.9.39
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}, {'_account_id': 3012, 'name': 'Dina Belova', 'email': 'dbelova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dbelova'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 8052, 'name': 'Nejc Saje', 'email': 'nejc@saje.info', 'username': 'nsaje'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-04 17:59:38.000000000', 'files': ['.testr.conf'], 'message': "Fix tests with testtools>=0.9.39

'rpc_backend' config option in
ceilometer.openstack.common.rpc.__init__.py defaults to
'%s.impl_kombu' % __package__. Because the RPC module is imported
in some other files as ceilometer.openstack.common.rpc, rpc_backend
is set to 'ceilometer.openstack.common.rpc.impl_kombu'. But when
the test loader tries to import the RPC module as openstack.common.rpc
(since it is starting inside the ceilometer folder), registering the
option fails, because we try to register a different default value.

The issue surfaced because testtools==0.9.39 started checking __init__.py
files as well. It is fixed by passing a top-level directory parameter to
the test discovery process.

Change-Id: I08036b54def3eb496772bcf183927b9f70bb7a86
Closes-bug: #1365613
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tests with testtools>=0.9.39

'rpc_backend' config option in
ceilometer.openstack.common.rpc.__init__.py defaults to
'%s.impl_kombu' % __package__. Because the RPC module is imported
in some other files as ceilometer.openstack.common.rpc, rpc_backend
is set to 'ceilometer.openstack.common.rpc.impl_kombu'. But when
the test loader tries to import the RPC module as openstack.common.rpc
(since it is starting inside the ceilometer folder), registering the
option fails, because we try to register a different default value.

The issue surfaced because testtools==0.9.39 started checking __init__.py
files as well. It is fixed by passing a top-level directory parameter to
the test discovery process.

Change-Id: I08036b54def3eb496772bcf183927b9f70bb7a86
Closes-bug: #1365613

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-08-30 00:20:02.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/db.py', 'test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': "Make some sqlite UPDATE calls only to records that have changed

Just to add some context, this has mainly been a problem on ext4
when there are enough containers to cause the container-replicator
to run continuously, which isn't all that many on a single
spindle storage node. Anyhow, the updates generate unnecessary
sql journal activity which in turn generate a lot of jbd2

Change-Id: I057a5f8971f06171ed966505e3b5092324f16ec9

commit_message:
Make some sqlite UPDATE calls only to records that have changed

Just to add some context, this has mainly been a problem on ext4
when there are enough containers to cause the container-replicator
to run continuously, which isn't all that many on a single
spindle storage node. Anyhow, the updates generate unnecessary
sql journal activity which in turn generate a lot of jbd2
(the ext4 journal daemon) writes.

Related-Bug: 1332025
Change-Id: I057a5f8971f06171ed966505e3b5092324f16ec9

As specified in the bug description, the listing of users by using the
email attribute as a filter would cause an exception. This is because
the email is not a first class attribute, yet it was considered so in
the filters. Thus, this fix will prevent the exception while also
preventing the filtering by email.

Change-Id: Ibf4b51a91c1e47e8197af49855307460559a7fc9

commit_message:
No longer allow listing users by email

As specified in the bug description, the listing of users by using the
email attribute as a filter would cause an exception. This is because
the email is not a first class attribute, yet it was considered so in
the filters. Thus, this fix will prevent the exception while also
preventing the filtering by email.

Change-Id: Ibf4b51a91c1e47e8197af49855307460559a7fc9
Closes-Bug: #1306835
(cherry picked from commit 75cca803739a5b4ef197666589582802c7391e17)

commit_message:
Support new IPv6 subnet modes in Neutron

This addresses addition of two new IPv6 subnet modes
called IPv6_RA_mode and IPv6_address_mode options in Neutron
at the time of creating an IPv6 subnet.

There are fixed values for both these modes.
They can be set to no_attribute_value or one of - slaac,
dhcpv6_stateful or dhcpv6_stateless.

These values represent how Router Advertisements (RAs) are
made for IPv6 address Neighbor discovery for VMs.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <motoki@da.jp.nec.com>
Implements: blueprint neutron-subnet-mode-support
Change-Id: I97abd3642b7da94cda85425534d934f30feb86d2

subject: CRUD grant functions don't check user_id and group_id
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-07-23 08:12:07.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/assignment/backends/ldap.py'], 'message': "CRUD grant functions don't check user_id and group_id

CRUD grant functions don't check if user_id and group_id exists.
role_id, domain_id, and project_id are checked, and this change
adds checking for user_id and group_id.

This issue could raise an unexpected exception caused by
an unexisting user or group.

Change-Id: I4d8d35f381271d4ffa3b682062dd038e2a360073
Closes-Bug: #1343932
"}]
commit_message:
CRUD grant functions don't check user_id and group_id

CRUD grant functions don't check if user_id and group_id exists.
role_id, domain_id, and project_id are checked, and this change
adds checking for user_id and group_id.

This issue could raise an unexpected exception caused by
an unexisting user or group.

Change-Id: I4d8d35f381271d4ffa3b682062dd038e2a360073
Closes-Bug: #1343932

commit_message:
Drop all direct usage of systemctl enable

Since we already have a wrapper script for enabling services called
os-svc-enable, drop all direct usage of systemctl enable, replacing
it with os-svc-enable.

Also drive-by replacements of == with =. == is a pattern match.

Change-Id: I707bf6f02207308e8f61caff17a27b0697096359

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-03 13:23:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/ioutils.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/vmutils.py'], 'message': 'Fixes HyperV VM Console Log

This patch intends to fix some small nits introduced along with
the Nova console log patch.

The size of the console log can get bigger than expected because
of a small nit when checking the existing log file size as well
as a wrong size constant.

The method which gets the serial port pipe at the moment returns
a list which contains at most one element being the actual pipe
path. In order to avoid confusion this should return the pipe path
or None instead of a list.

Change-Id: I34e7203716efef8002d463fe6789b36f66ccf535
Closes-Bug: #1363899
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes HyperV VM Console Log

This patch intends to fix some small nits introduced along with
the Nova console log patch.

The size of the console log can get bigger than expected because
of a small nit when checking the existing log file size as well
as a wrong size constant.

The method which gets the serial port pipe at the moment returns
a list which contains at most one element being the actual pipe
path. In order to avoid confusion this should return the pipe path
or None instead of a list.

Change-Id: I34e7203716efef8002d463fe6789b36f66ccf535
Closes-Bug: #1363899

commit_message:
Use ipv6 subnet with /64 prefix in ipv6 network API test

SLAAC address mode for ipv6 subnet requires /64 prefix in order to
function properly, so set cidr for the ipv6 subnet explicitly.

Change-Id: I3f0c2a6aee41291e89b0835081e8c7ebcc2c9f04
Closes-Bug: #1361140
Related-Bug: #1357084

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-07 19:22:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/image/test_glance.py'], 'message': "Mock glance client object in version unit tests

This patch changes the glance client version unit tests
to mock the Client object completely.  Previously the
tests were ensuring the right version of the client was
returned, but that required too much knowledge of glance's
implementation and ended up breaking the tests when glance
changed the implementation details of the Client class.

The new code tests if cinder is calling the integration
point correctly for the version, rather than if glance
is correctly returning the right client; that should be
a glance test, not a cinder test.

Closes-Bug: 1366596
Change-Id: I979175e6c3b5f98076bde6d36ca52fb8b03009b8
(cherry-picked from 04abab869d28e007d9b869122740f70cd839daf7)
"}]
commit_message:
Mock glance client object in version unit tests

This patch changes the glance client version unit tests
to mock the Client object completely.  Previously the
tests were ensuring the right version of the client was
returned, but that required too much knowledge of glance's
implementation and ended up breaking the tests when glance
changed the implementation details of the Client class.

The new code tests if cinder is calling the integration
point correctly for the version, rather than if glance
is correctly returning the right client; that should be
a glance test, not a cinder test.

Closes-Bug: 1366596
Change-Id: I979175e6c3b5f98076bde6d36ca52fb8b03009b8
(cherry-picked from 04abab869d28e007d9b869122740f70cd839daf7)

commit_message:
Change v3 security_groups API to v2.1

This patch changes v3 security_groups API to v2.1 and makes v2 unit tests
share between v2 and v2.1.
This patch doesn't revert /os-security-groups, /os-security-group-rules
and /servers/server_id/os-security-groups because these features are
implemented in Networking API. On v2.1 API, we decide we don't need to
implement proxying features.

The differences between v2 and v3 are described on the wiki page
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaAPIv2tov3 .

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I82660fd514d041bdd1fad0e689fa4fe90d441c47

commit_message:
Add characterization test for group role assignment listing

There was no test that shows what happens when a group assignment is
created and the role assignments are listed (for all backends). The
LDAP assignment backend works incorrectly in that it returns user
assignments for group assignments.

Change-Id: I69bc3501cc5eae3039d805ed006821d6927f0440
Partial-Bug: #1365787

subject: wrapper: clean the source dir before a checkout
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-08 04:37:31.000000000', 'files': ['autogenerate_config_docs/autohelp-wrapper'], 'message': "wrapper: clean the source dir before a checkout

Git doesn't clear folders containing untracked files when switching to
another branch. The autohelp script uses invalid .pyc files when such
switches happen in the diff_branches.py script. This change removes all
the .pyc files before a checkout to avoid this problem.

Change-Id: I0acd0308a3651b27d158546036de5cb0b42d974c
"}]
commit_message:
wrapper: clean the source dir before a checkout

Git doesn't clear folders containing untracked files when switching to
another branch. The autohelp script uses invalid .pyc files when such
switches happen in the diff_branches.py script. This change removes all
the .pyc files before a checkout to avoid this problem.

Change-Id: I0acd0308a3651b27d158546036de5cb0b42d974c

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-01 03:18:05.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/orchestration/json/orchestration_client.py'], 'message': "Fix response body format of orchestration_client to dict

'create_stack' function in orchestration_client return raw json strings.
However, in most of cases, raw json strings are not expected because it's
too hard to use. So we should do 'json.loads(body)' for the response body.
And the other apis such as {update,delete,suspend,resume} do not return a
response body in the API spec docs[1]. So we do not need to add
'json.load(body)' to the functions for now.

[1] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-orchestration-v1.html

Change-Id: Ic7d37d70aa0373d9bbf3ad302d1a521f5adaafe9
"}]
commit_message:
Fix response body format of orchestration_client to dict

'create_stack' function in orchestration_client return raw json strings.
However, in most of cases, raw json strings are not expected because it's
too hard to use. So we should do 'json.loads(body)' for the response body.
And the other apis such as {update,delete,suspend,resume} do not return a
response body in the API spec docs[1]. So we do not need to add
'json.load(body)' to the functions for now.

[1] http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-orchestration-v1.html

Change-Id: Ic7d37d70aa0373d9bbf3ad302d1a521f5adaafe9

If the branch does not exist locally, create it properly.

commit_message:
Fix git checkout

If the branch does not exist locally, create it properly.
Otherwise the script will abort with freshly checkout sources.

This patch changes the glance client version unit tests
to mock the Client object completely.  Previously the
tests were ensuring the right version of the client was
returned, but that required too much knowledge of glance's
implementation and ended up breaking the tests when glance
changed the implementation details of the Client class.

The new code tests if cinder is calling the integration
point correctly for the version, rather than if glance
is correctly returning the right client; that should be

"}]
commit_message:
Mock glance client object in version unit tests

This patch changes the glance client version unit tests
to mock the Client object completely.  Previously the
tests were ensuring the right version of the client was
returned, but that required too much knowledge of glance's
implementation and ended up breaking the tests when glance
changed the implementation details of the Client class.

The new code tests if cinder is calling the integration
point correctly for the version, rather than if glance
is correctly returning the right client; that should be
a glance test, not a cinder test.

Closes-Bug: 1366596
Change-Id: I979175e6c3b5f98076bde6d36ca52fb8b03009b8

 * Action factory register actions in DB at starting
 * Added script tools/sync_db.sh for sync with db
   (Updates system actions, it is required before
   first Mistral launch)
 * Changed init Mistral in devstack: we must do
   sync_db before the launching.

 * Since we have to write all actions in DB, unit
   test are also modified:
    * Now in tearDown() we don't drop db at all,
      but just delete all things except Actions.
    * Created heavy_init() method as a replacement

      heavy_init() method.

TODO:

Change-Id: If4416c4da5c05189126c109aa613a0303c1b7ef0

commit_message:
Modify action_factory to store actions in DB

 * Action factory register actions in DB at starting
 * Added script tools/sync_db.sh for sync with db
   (Updates system actions, it is required before
   first Mistral launch)
 * Changed init Mistral in devstack: we must do
   sync_db before the launching.

 * Since we have to write all actions in DB, unit
   test are also modified:
    * Now in tearDown() we don't drop db at all,
      but just delete all things except Actions.
    * Created heavy_init() method as a replacement
      setUpClass(), see comments in tests/base.py
    * Register actions operation is too much expensive
      operation so we create db and init actions in
      heavy_init() method.

TODO:
 * Provide executor info to construct action class in
   runtime using action_factory
 * Modify/write an instruction 'How to start Mistral'

Change-Id: If4416c4da5c05189126c109aa613a0303c1b7ef0

On the commit I74261baac4fbf121826808ef55dfed960422b964, we found a
strange test result. Glance returns HTTP409 response if conflicting
image-id on "create an image" API, but Tempest raises a ServerFault

commit_message:
Do not merge: [Glance] Add a test for conflicting image-id

On the commit I74261baac4fbf121826808ef55dfed960422b964, we found a
strange test result. Glance returns HTTP409 response if conflicting
image-id on "create an image" API, but Tempest raises a ServerFault
exception and it seems Tempest receives HTTP500/501.
This patch is only for digging this problem.

Change-Id: I8ab8a4204f352346ae1a4a79ecfa3b907218e4f8

commit_message:
Fix bind_router debug log when called inside a transaction

If there is an outer transaction, the access to chosen_agent.id in the
except clause will fail.  To avoid this, save the value beforehand.

Change-Id: Ib3ebd2d12eb9579ff29cfde9d9bf8215dd9abd74
Closes-Bug: 1360104

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-05-06 00:25:05.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': 'Fixed stack.sh environment variables setting issue [bug #1316326]

When a user without proper privilege tries to execute stack.sh to
install Openstack, stack.sh will failed and create a lot of
null environment variables to affect the following scripts
because of no permission to access related files.
This fix will check the exit status to source environments,
if return code not 0, the stack.sh will quit and not produce null
envionment variables to affect next running.
Closes-Bug: 1316326

Change-Id: I4006cb122fa9d850fea8d22cf444f6704709dd2b
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed stack.sh environment variables setting issue [bug #1316326]

When a user without proper privilege tries to execute stack.sh to
install Openstack, stack.sh will failed and create a lot of
null environment variables to affect the following scripts
because of no permission to access related files.
This fix will check the exit status to source environments,
if return code not 0, the stack.sh will quit and not produce null
envionment variables to affect next running.
Closes-Bug: 1316326

Change-Id: I4006cb122fa9d850fea8d22cf444f6704709dd2b

commit_message:
Fix to avoid undefined variables in initial sanity checks

This commit moves check to see if screen is already running after reading
stackrc, and changes messages in check if root is running DevStack.
STACK_USER is defined in stackrc, and SCREEN_NAME can be replaced with
"a non-root account".

Change-Id: I022ed1099169a3549b7e31883abe33d6298f6fa5
Closes-Bug: #1362091

subject: Use oslotest rather than copying helpers
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-07 23:44:30.000000000', 'files': ['{{cookiecutter.repo_name}}/{{cookiecutter.module_name}}/tests/base.py', '{{cookiecutter.repo_name}}/test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Use oslotest rather than copying helpers

The basic test setup is now handled by oslotest and the recommended way
of setting up tests should be to use that.

This theoretically means we should be able to remove testtools from
test-requirements.txt however it has been left as it will likely be
needed later.

Fixtures was removed as a dependency because commonly the required
fixtures would have been set up by oslotest.

Change-Id: I7fa71207ef56ce308fbe4e7a77fa3b9a7e2444ae
'}]
commit_message:
Use oslotest rather than copying helpers

The basic test setup is now handled by oslotest and the recommended way
of setting up tests should be to use that.

This theoretically means we should be able to remove testtools from
test-requirements.txt however it has been left as it will likely be
needed later.

Fixtures was removed as a dependency because commonly the required
fixtures would have been set up by oslotest.

Change-Id: I7fa71207ef56ce308fbe4e7a77fa3b9a7e2444ae

subject: Fix indentation in tox.ini
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-26 15:49:10.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Fix indentation in tox.ini

Previously, a tab was used to indent a line with a block of code which
otherwise uses eight spaces, causing it to display strangely in text
editors which do not have tabstop=8 set.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I99a432373beebac912df88e6685db26e738bf654
'}]
commit_message:
Fix indentation in tox.ini

Previously, a tab was used to indent a line with a block of code which
otherwise uses eight spaces, causing it to display strangely in text
editors which do not have tabstop=8 set.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I99a432373beebac912df88e6685db26e738bf654

commit_message:
Revert "Cisco DFA ML2 Mechanism Driver"

This reverts commit 3680fd61c9a1cceaa011b4d0d37d235abf490c50.

The reverted patch incorrectly ties with Keystone and should have never been
approved since the approved version only partially addressed review concerns.

This revert also ensure migration timeline integrity.

Change-Id: If5fbdade72c762b21a477676ded816ce5be97ca5

commit_message:
Allow _poll_bandwidth_usage task to hit slave

Deployments that have a slave_connection configured can offload
read queries generated by this periodic task there. For
deployments with no slave, behavior remains the same.

Change-Id: Ibf27cdb94bc9b8c50066207c6285666cb29ebbf6
Blueprint: juno-slaveification

commit_message:
Ignore 'dynamic' addr flag on bridge configuration

When setting the bridge up, if that flag is present but not
ignored, the delete command will fail and may leave the
interface and the bridge in an inconsistent state.

Closes-Bug: #1274611
Related-Bug: #1077066
Change-Id: Id8bcd76f44b7e7502e0ed64ca85eb6b5983704fd
(cherry picked from commit 0d447f6edd406547e828c592823ac6624e56e91f)

subject: Add nested/hierarchical state machine support
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-08-21 22:11:45.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/types/fsm.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_types.py'], 'message': 'Add nested/hierarchical state machine support

Nested/hierarchical state machines have a bunch of useful
properties that it would be great to have for the projects
that want to use it...

To name a few:

- The ability to reduce state and transition duplication
  by the ability of a hierarchical state machine to be
  able to *delegate* to a parent state machine on unknown
  events.
- Easier to understand and reduced state machines size; state
  machines at each level of the hierarchy can be simplified
  to only handle states they are made for (do one and only one
  thing well).
- Easier to compose machines; machines can be created that
  do one set of actions and states reliably, and this machine
  can be included in another machine that wants to use that
  same functionality.
- More...

Change-Id: I47812809aa9a6fd00ad7ee170be859d06e953c38
'}]
commit_message:
Add nested/hierarchical state machine support

Nested/hierarchical state machines have a bunch of useful
properties that it would be great to have for the projects
that want to use it...

To name a few:

- The ability to reduce state and transition duplication
  by the ability of a hierarchical state machine to be
  able to *delegate* to a parent state machine on unknown
  events.
- Easier to understand and reduced state machines size; state
  machines at each level of the hierarchy can be simplified
  to only handle states they are made for (do one and only one
  thing well).
- Easier to compose machines; machines can be created that
  do one set of actions and states reliably, and this machine
  can be included in another machine that wants to use that
  same functionality.
- More...

Change-Id: I47812809aa9a6fd00ad7ee170be859d06e953c38

This patch covers next topics:

commit_message:
Support for benchmarking with existing users (part 1)

This patch covers next topics:

1) Changes db deploymnet model to store admin endpoint and list of
   non-admin users

2) Changes objects.deployment to have this admin and users instead of
   endpoints

3) Changes input format of ExistingCloud engine, to make it easy to
   pass users & admins

4) Changes engine.bind method to accept admin and list of users

5) Code cleanup related to removing list of endpoints and making
   admin/non-admin stuff

6) Fix CLI code related to deployment model change

7) Fix docs & samples

8) Fixing all related tests

In next patch we should drop default "users" context and use users
from deployment if they are passed.

Change-Id: Ifb469d80c61ee5f26f313db75c98a6d496bcdb92

commit_message:
Fix wrong command for _rescan_multipath

The _run_multipath command is wrong in [1], it should be 'multipath -r'
not 'multipath - r'. And adds test for this.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py#L590

Change-Id: I3c5d12cc11988d65a8fc9e6143d26c2d1220d253
Closes-bug: 1362916

Add a binding capability to the Big Switch ML2 mechanism
driver to mark external ports as bound. Ports with the
owner type 'neutron:external_port' will be assigned to the first
VLAN segment available in the network. The port update operation
will then carry the HOST ID with the identifier to the backend
for the necessary fabric configuration.

Implements: blueprint bsn-ml2-ext-attach
Change-Id: I7b749ba5ef9a47b45be24f77656a10ed38e5e6ae
"}]
commit_message:
BSN: Bind external ports in ML2 driver

Add a binding capability to the Big Switch ML2 mechanism
driver to mark external ports as bound. Ports with the
owner type 'neutron:external_port' will be assigned to the first
VLAN segment available in the network. The port update operation
will then carry the HOST ID with the identifier to the backend
for the necessary fabric configuration.

Implements: blueprint bsn-ml2-ext-attach
Change-Id: I7b749ba5ef9a47b45be24f77656a10ed38e5e6ae

subject: Translate the engine runner into a well defined state-machine
revisions:
[{'number': 26, 'created': '2014-09-07 15:49:36.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/types/fsm.py', 'requirements-py2.txt', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/runner.py', 'requirements-py3.txt', 'taskflow/tests/unit/action_engine/test_runner.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_types.py'], 'message': 'Translate the engine runner into a well defined state-machine

Instead of having a ad-hoc state-machine being used to perform
the various runtime actions (performed when a engine is ran) we
can gain a much more explict execution model by translating that
ad-hoc state machine to an explicit one instead...

This commit does just that, it adds a new fsm type that can be
used to create, define and run state-machines that respond to
various events (internal or external) and uses it in the runner action
engine module to run the previously ad-hc/implicit state-machine.

Implements blueprint runner-state-machine

Change-Id: Id35633a9de707f3ffb1a4b7e9619af1be009317f
'}]
commit_message:
Translate the engine runner into a well defined state-machine

Instead of having a ad-hoc state-machine being used to perform
the various runtime actions (performed when a engine is ran) we
can gain a much more explict execution model by translating that
ad-hoc state machine to an explicit one instead...

This commit does just that, it adds a new fsm type that can be
used to create, define and run state-machines that respond to
various events (internal or external) and uses it in the runner action
engine module to run the previously ad-hc/implicit state-machine.

Implements blueprint runner-state-machine

Change-Id: Id35633a9de707f3ffb1a4b7e9619af1be009317f

commit_message:

repository set up. It is easier to just do this automatically than have

commit_message:
VMware: Remove VMwareVCVMOps

This support is no longer needed as we only support the VC driver
since commit 1deb31f85a8f5d1e261b2cf1eddc537a5da7f60b.

The patch makes use of VMwareVMOps. All of the specific VC methods
are moved into this class.

partial blueprint vmware-spawn-refactor

Change-Id: Ieb2198a956853c75855e3b4441cc3a893b2e6079

commit_message:
VMware: image user functions for spawn()

Refactor each mode of using cached images when configuring a newly
created virtual machine into their own functions.

DocImpact:
vmware_linked_clone image property is ignored when spawning an
image that is an ISO.

partial-blueprint: vmware-spawn-refactor
Change-Id: I863fc0ef644bcf579e74d6f567f14aed98a23c84

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1 access_ips extension

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-schema

Change-Id: I495e7538e5d8d67f19792dfa0427ab7a1b0068cf

commit_message:
Add action 'user password set' for identiy v3

This new action will allow a user to change their own password by
either providing the new password as an argument (--password) or by
being prompted to enter the new password.
In both cases user will be prompted to enter their current password
as required by the v3 API.

Closes-Bug: #1337245
Change-Id: I5e1e0fd2b46a4502318da57f7cce2b236fb2d93d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-04 14:18:38.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/jsonutils.py'], 'message': "Check for namedtuple_as_object support before using it

Commit ad248f6658d572f3f4721f804325db754e9c931d introduced the usage of
the namedtuple_as_object kwarg if using simplejson.

However, that kwarg isn't available until simplejson 2.2.0 which is a
problem for anyone running a RHEL/CentOS 6 distribution.

Normally this would not be a big deal since we can bump minimum required
versions but in this case simplejson is an optional runtime dependency
so most projects don't list it in their requirements.txt files.  So if
you are running with simplejson < 2.2.0 (you might not even know it) and
upgrade, things are going to get sad very quick.

Rather than assume people will be at the right level or figure it out,
let's be smarter and just check if the kwarg is available in the version
of simplejson we're using.  If we don't have a new enough version of
simplejson then fallback to using json despite the performance issues
on python 2.6.

This can be removed in Kilo when python 2.6 support is dropped so this
should be short-term workaround that saves some headaches once Juno is
released.

Closes-Bug: #1361230

Change-Id: Iadc2d28a1a0b125a34ed08344673c6b4a8a758e9
(cherry picked from commit 4d61c826eff57e112417e948f7166e8b29425f4a)
"}]
commit_message:
Check for namedtuple_as_object support before using it

Commit ad248f6658d572f3f4721f804325db754e9c931d introduced the usage of
the namedtuple_as_object kwarg if using simplejson.

However, that kwarg isn't available until simplejson 2.2.0 which is a
problem for anyone running a RHEL/CentOS 6 distribution.

Normally this would not be a big deal since we can bump minimum required
versions but in this case simplejson is an optional runtime dependency
so most projects don't list it in their requirements.txt files.  So if
you are running with simplejson < 2.2.0 (you might not even know it) and
upgrade, things are going to get sad very quick.

Rather than assume people will be at the right level or figure it out,
let's be smarter and just check if the kwarg is available in the version
of simplejson we're using.  If we don't have a new enough version of
simplejson then fallback to using json despite the performance issues
on python 2.6.

This can be removed in Kilo when python 2.6 support is dropped so this
should be short-term workaround that saves some headaches once Juno is
released.

Closes-Bug: #1361230

Change-Id: Iadc2d28a1a0b125a34ed08344673c6b4a8a758e9
(cherry picked from commit 4d61c826eff57e112417e948f7166e8b29425f4a)

commit_message:
Convert v3 ExtendedAvailabilityZone api to v2.1

This patch changes v3 ExtendedAvailabilityZone API to v2.1
and makes v2 unit tests share between v2 and v2.1.

The differences between v2 and v3 are described on the wiki page
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/NovaAPIv2tov3.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I49baff38b7a9dabd40550267c2119fe84137594f

commit_message:
Don't run lbaas scenario test as smoke test

Load Balancer as a service  is not part of neutron's primary
functionality, it is one of the advanced services that is not fully
baked yet. As part of the effort to only test advanced services against
neutron and not against all projects, drop this test from smoke.

Related patch: Ib315d30ff3c4463203f7ebe00e159a9680cf1616

Change-Id: I43239e9dc3e99e382ea12fb94f940f9029f4e488

commit_message:
Unordered dicts and lists causes variable results

The unordered dict and lists causes variable results.  The user
may see different results and tests can fail.  Might as well make
this more consistent.

commit_message:
Fix handling of arguments in autohelp-wrapper

The shift should happen after the final processing, otherwise
getopts aborts if more than one parameter is given.

Change-Id: I47e9f390cfe08404e71b26c49b02871b3b34f303

commit_message:
Handle ExternalNetworkAttachForbidden exception

When creating an instance and assigning a public network
to it without admin authority, ExternalNetworkAttachForbidden
will be raised. But this exception is not handled in V3 api.

Change-Id: Id70d8eaa704fd82cef1afdb65756d75cb56fbdce
Closes-Bug: #1353949

commit_message:
Implements sync mechanism between Neutron and Nuage VSD

This will sync resources between Neutron and VSD based on
the configuration parameters. "enable_sync" will enable/disable
the sync and "sync_interval" will control the time interval
between consecutive sync cycles.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I6730bf0166dfd1e35795b679293a2831b5afbc75
Implements: blueprint nuage-neutron-sync

commit_message:
Port used_limits & used_limits_for_admin into v2.1

The used_limits & used_limits_for_admin is removed from v3 API.
For now, we need porting it back. And also try to share unittests
between v2 and v2.1.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I57199273dcaf20b0b6618dfb436a92f04b139f52

commit_message:
Big Switch: Bind IVS ports in ML2 driver

Add support to bind IVS ports in the Big Switch ML2
mechanism driver. The backend controller will be checked
to determine if a host is connected using the Indigo vswitch.
If so, the mechanism driver will mark it as bound since
it will be provisioned by the backend controller.

Implements: blueprint bsn-ml2-bind-ivs
Change-Id: Ic481fc31c8c123899fddf8185c32f127dff53b7a

commit_message:
Fix use of nonexistent class variable in accounts

This commit fixes cases in tempest.common.accounts cases where some
methods were attempting to use non-existent class level variables.
It also improves the get_hash methods and calls to remove_hash.

Co-Authored-By: Andrea Frittoli <andrea.frittoli@hp.com>
Change-Id: I30cf59b981e0db3a3e50357a8db489519767c0ca

Some v2.1 APIs(create/update/rebuild server) contains the API

It is necessary to change the API schemas also automatically based
on the API extension loading condition, because the API extensions
add API parameters.

This patch adds API schema extensions which are implemented with the
same mechanism (stevedore library) as the API extension for "update

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1 "update a server" API

Some v2.1 APIs(create/update/rebuild server) contains the API
extension feature, it searches extension methods with its method
name and operates them automatically.
It is necessary to change the API schemas also automatically based
on the API extension loading condition, because the API extensions
add API parameters.

This patch adds API schema extensions which are implemented with the
same mechanism (stevedore library) as the API extension for "update
a server" extensions.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-schema

Change-Id: I2f80a994bc69153bd40251827aad0479876a94ab

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1 "rebuild a server" API

Some v2.1 APIs(create/update/rebuild server) contains the API
extension feature, it searches extension methods with its method
name and operates them automatically.
It is necessary to change the API schemas also automatically based
on the API extension loading condition, because the API extensions
add API parameters.

This patch adds API schema extensions which are implemented with the
same mechanism (stevedore library) as the API extension for "rebuild
a server" extensions.

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-schema

Change-Id: Ibfdd99966335d062cde4cc1d9ab3b63bc82ed0b6

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-07-13 18:38:45.000000000', 'files': ['swift/locale/swift.pot', 'locale/swift.pot', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Setup localization properly

To start translation of swift, we need to initially import the
translation file - and place it at the proper place so that
the usual CI scripts can handle it.

The proper place is for all python projects
$PROJECT/locale/$PROJECT.pot, so move locale/$PROJECT.pot to the new
location and regenerate the file.

Update setup.cfg with the new paths.

Further imports will be done by the OpenStack Proposal bot.

Change-Id: Ide4da91f2af71db529f4a06d6b1e30ba79883506
Partial-Bug: #608725
Closes-Bug: #1082805
'}]
commit_message:
Setup localization properly

To start translation of swift, we need to initially import the
translation file - and place it at the proper place so that
the usual CI scripts can handle it.

The proper place is for all python projects
$PROJECT/locale/$PROJECT.pot, so move locale/$PROJECT.pot to the new
location and regenerate the file.

Update setup.cfg with the new paths.

Further imports will be done by the OpenStack Proposal bot.

Change-Id: Ide4da91f2af71db529f4a06d6b1e30ba79883506
Partial-Bug: #608725
Closes-Bug: #1082805

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-09-03 17:54:25.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/dashboard/scss/horizon.scss'], 'message': 'Fixed incorrect position of modal container.

After updating to bootrap 3, the position of the modal
container is incorrect when you scroll down on a page
then select an action button towards the top of the page that brings up
a modal dialog.  The dialog is displayed off the bottom of the screen.

I couldnt find a graceful way to fix the css issue, so I had to over-
ride a bootstrap css rule using !important.

Change-Id: I5539692a6657555e08e893339098159306836021
Closes-bug: #1353897
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed incorrect position of modal container.

After updating to bootrap 3, the position of the modal
container is incorrect when you scroll down on a page
then select an action button towards the top of the page that brings up
a modal dialog.  The dialog is displayed off the bottom of the screen.

I couldnt find a graceful way to fix the css issue, so I had to over-
ride a bootstrap css rule using !important.

Change-Id: I5539692a6657555e08e893339098159306836021
Closes-bug: #1353897

We can get vm memory stats from libvirt API
'virDomainMemoryStats', it help telemetry module
like as: Ceilometer to collect vm memory usage,
but by default the memory statistical feature is
disable in qemu, we need to add stats period
in order to enabled memory statistical.

DocImpact: Adds mem_stats_period_seconds to

Implements: blueprint enabled-qemu-memballoon-stats

commit_message:
Enabled qemu memory balloon stats

We can get vm memory stats from libvirt API
'virDomainMemoryStats', it help telemetry module
like as: Ceilometer to collect vm memory usage,
but by default the memory statistical feature is
disable in qemu, we need to add stats period
in order to enabled memory statistical.

DocImpact: Adds mem_stats_period_seconds to
the [libvirt] group of nova.conf

Change-Id: Ie5c615565ffbe5d70394f2ddba162ace14abe24e
Implements: blueprint enabled-qemu-memballoon-stats

commit_message:
Make unit tests not depend on random hash seed

This commit fixes the places in the tempest unit tests which were
dependent on the python hashseed being 0. They were mostly issues of
expectations, either explicit or inadvertently implicit, on dict or
list ordering.

Change-Id: Iab72ed4d52765de744804e6202ee4bf0664988c5

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-08-06 20:46:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py'], 'message': 'Remove pre-icehouse rpc client API compat

The compute rpc API was at version 3.23 for the Icehouse release.
Since we only support live upgrades from N-1 to N (Icehouse to Juno),
we can remove old rpc client support for versions that were
pre-Icehouse release.  This patch does that for the compute rpcapi.

Change-Id: Ice20b141dbe28de02e125fa5ced1dbc286ba2ee3
'}]
commit_message:
Remove pre-icehouse rpc client API compat

The compute rpc API was at version 3.23 for the Icehouse release.
Since we only support live upgrades from N-1 to N (Icehouse to Juno),
we can remove old rpc client support for versions that were
pre-Icehouse release.  This patch does that for the compute rpcapi.

Change-Id: Ice20b141dbe28de02e125fa5ced1dbc286ba2ee3

commit_message:
Use netifaces to lookup IP address on guest agent

The current way of looking up the IP address on the guest
doesn't correctly work across all platforms. Use netifaces
instead which works correctly across all platforms.

Change-Id: I3d5febb1dd801fdf7801613cd843e7c00f308016

commit_message:
Cleanup rename of get_compute_ports_on_host_by_subnet

A recent merge [1] renamed this method to remove "compute_" from the
name.  Unfortunately, the rename was not done thoroughly.  This patch
cleans that up.  No bug is referenced since this is an obvious
ommission in a recent patch.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/114141/

Change-Id: I8320bc8deb6dcda586ccff01120270b3ce257ea2

commit_message:
Cisco N1kv plugin to send subtype on network profile creation

Make sure that the cisco n1kv neutron plugin sends the sub_type too
when a overlay network profile is created

Change-Id: I37e63131039077fa80a28fe725c09f0307acc2ea
Closes-Bug: 1357125
(cherry picked from commit e6ffc08de72a21980cde38d1a716d429311f7819)

Ports v2 image-size extension and adapts it to the v2.1/v3 API
framework. API behaviour is identical with the exception
that there is no support for XML. Also

- unittest code modified to share testing with both v2/v2.1
- Adds expected error decorators for API methods

Change-Id: I44f3d35b3d888e2f4429ca0788d74b9b0cce9494

commit_message:
Port image-size extension to work in v2.1/v3 framework

Ports v2 image-size extension and adapts it to the v2.1/v3 API
framework. API behaviour is identical with the exception
that there is no support for XML. Also

- unittest code modified to share testing with both v2/v2.1
- Adds expected error decorators for API methods

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I44f3d35b3d888e2f4429ca0788d74b9b0cce9494

commit_message:
Port v2 image_metadata extension to work in v2.1(v3) framework

Port v2 image_metadata extension and adapts it to the v2.1/v3 API
framework. API behaviour is identical with the exception that
there is no support for XML. Also

- unittest code modified to share existing testing with both
  v2/v2.1
- Adds expected error decorators for API methods
- Adds API samples

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ibc8dc897f3449a1c70bc7ac1510445f48fddb291

Debugging bug 1353131.

We have some logic to retry on deadlock but it isn't triggering here,
add some logs to help sort out what is happening.

commit_message:
Align swift's store API

swift's store get method was lacking of 2 keyword arguments. This patch
adds them to the API.

Change-Id: I8f67380b4ca07261bc3d4e6fbd201189d1087a96

subject: Add `OPTIONS` attribute to swift.Store function
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-05 11:02:02.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/swift/utils.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py', 'glance_store/backend.py'], 'message': 'Add `OPTIONS` attribute to swift.Store function

Swift uses a function to wrap the final store instance and choose
between a SingleTenant/MultiTenant store. This patch adds the `OPTIONS`
attribute, found in all other store classes, in order to be able to
register the store options without actually creating an instance of the
Store - just like in every other store.

Iterate over swift/utils.py options, in order to add a deprecate options
for each one of those.

Change-Id: I581cdf5e8e5c112e129c2f0d62ad2a9caf19383b
'}]
commit_message:
Add `OPTIONS` attribute to swift.Store function

Swift uses a function to wrap the final store instance and choose
between a SingleTenant/MultiTenant store. This patch adds the `OPTIONS`
attribute, found in all other store classes, in order to be able to
register the store options without actually creating an instance of the
Store - just like in every other store.

Iterate over swift/utils.py options, in order to add a deprecate options
for each one of those.

Change-Id: I581cdf5e8e5c112e129c2f0d62ad2a9caf19383b

Add the missing stores to setup.cfg and add the old stores to keep
backwards compatibility. In addition, raise an error if a store
entry_point is not found.

commit_message:
Set group for DeprecatedOpts

Deprecated options' group must be explicitly set, otherwise it'll lookup
the old option in the group the new one was registered in.

Change-Id: Idd0abd639373d9769ba6c520604f0e46a9b6f1ec

commit_message:
Complete random_access for the filesystem store

This patch completes the support for random_access for the filesystem
store. It adds the required tests and modifies `ChunkFile` in a way that
it keeps backwards compatibility and adds support for this feature.

Change-Id: Ifaf6488165616c87debbb86b9dffa780df8c4b5f
Implements-blueprint: restartable-image-download

subject: Register store's configs w/o creating instances
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-03 15:54:31.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/driver.py', 'glance_store/backend.py'], 'message': "Register store's configs w/o creating instances

Instead of invoking the each store to register the config options, we
should just load the class and access `OPTIONS` from there. The old
attempt for config options registration is kept for other purposes.

Change-Id: I5545c1bd0ff0fd613cd40aadd87aaa4cbf2685ac
"}]
commit_message:
Register store's configs w/o creating instances

Instead of invoking the each store to register the config options, we
should just load the class and access `OPTIONS` from there. The old
attempt for config options registration is kept for other purposes.

Change-Id: I5545c1bd0ff0fd613cd40aadd87aaa4cbf2685ac

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-03 11:43:40.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/driver.py'], 'message': 'Add deprecated options support for storage drivers

Instead of requiring all storage driver options to be migrated

commit_message:
Add deprecated options support for storage drivers

Instead of requiring all storage driver options to be migrated
immediately, provide an upgrade path by supporting all config options
that used to be under the `DEFAULT` section.

Change-Id: Id978830c67f6c93b18e73cc16da92b99702357f5

commit_message:
Refactor searchutils module to base entity classes

Instead of a special module with search methods for different entities (by query),
implement them inside corresponding classes. Modify the "rally info" code appropriately.

Change-Id: Iba6c25752a191eedfc483bac2b4475bba5aa1e58

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2014-08-13 14:12:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: persist lxc attached volumes across reboots and power down

Currently, attached volumes to a LXC instance will be lost, when
hard rebooting or powering it down.
Adjusting the get_storage_config() to include LXC volumes in the
domain configuration.
The change will add all volumes to the instance config, a part from
the root device mapping.
When (re)creating a LXC instance, get_bdms_to_connect() generator
from block_device module, will be used to exclude the root device
mapping for a domain configuration.

Co-authored-by: Sam Morrison<sorrison@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1269990
Change-Id: I0aa227ede5fca065c6da15506d8cc4391d993e20
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: persist lxc attached volumes across reboots and power down

Currently, attached volumes to a LXC instance will be lost, when
hard rebooting or powering it down.
Adjusting the get_storage_config() to include LXC volumes in the
domain configuration.
The change will add all volumes to the instance config, a part from
the root device mapping.
When (re)creating a LXC instance, get_bdms_to_connect() generator
from block_device module, will be used to exclude the root device
mapping for a domain configuration.

Co-authored-by: Sam Morrison<sorrison@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1269990
Change-Id: I0aa227ede5fca065c6da15506d8cc4391d993e20

commit_message:
Deprecate the V1 API

This gives a warning for using the V1 API in Juno and encourages users
to switch to V2 before the K release where it will be removed.

DocImpact
Implements blueprint deprecate-v1-api
Change-Id: I89eb9eb2a7819edb2a97b2ea2b5239a89124ca4d

subject: Tweak engine iteration 'close-up shop' runtime path
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6648, 'name': 'Changbin Liu', 'email': 'changbin.liu@gmail.com', 'username': 'changbl'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9608, 'name': 'Pranesh Pandurangan', 'email': 'praneshpg@gmail.com', 'username': 'pran1990'}, {'_account_id': 9648, 'name': 'Greg Hill', 'email': 'greg.hill@rackspace.com', 'username': 'jimbobhickville'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-09-05 01:16:07.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py', 'taskflow/tests/utils.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/runner.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_action_engine_runner.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_action_engine_compile.py'], 'message': "Tweak engine iteration 'close-up shop' runtime path

1. Have the runner yield the final set of failures instead of
   raising them, this allows the same yield syntax to be used
   for all exit points that the runner run_iter() produces and
   now raise failures from the main engine run loop to match this
   change.
2. Use a context manager instead of try/finally to start and
   stop the action engines task executor (teenie niceness...)
3. When the engine run_iter() is used and the generator that is
   returned is closed, instead of breaking from the run loop, which
   can leave running tasks incomplete instead continue running and
   signal to the runner that the engine has suspended itself. This
   ensures that the running atoms are not lost when the generator from
   run_iter() is closed (for whatever reason) before finishing.

Also adds a bunch of useful tests that directly test the runner instead
of the indirect testing that we were doing before.

Fixes bug 1361013

Change-Id: I1b598e26f0b3877c8f7004f87bacdb7f5e9c9897
"}]
commit_message:
Tweak engine iteration 'close-up shop' runtime path

1. Have the runner yield the final set of failures instead of
   raising them, this allows the same yield syntax to be used
   for all exit points that the runner run_iter() produces and
   now raise failures from the main engine run loop to match this
   change.
2. Use a context manager instead of try/finally to start and
   stop the action engines task executor (teenie niceness...)
3. When the engine run_iter() is used and the generator that is
   returned is closed, instead of breaking from the run loop, which
   can leave running tasks incomplete instead continue running and
   signal to the runner that the engine has suspended itself. This
   ensures that the running atoms are not lost when the generator from
   run_iter() is closed (for whatever reason) before finishing.

Also adds a bunch of useful tests that directly test the runner instead
of the indirect testing that we were doing before.

Fixes bug 1361013

Change-Id: I1b598e26f0b3877c8f7004f87bacdb7f5e9c9897

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-09-05 20:47:38.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/test/tests/tables.py', 'horizon/tables/base.py'], 'message': "Add attributes to cell in a table depending on data

This feature helps users to selectively add attributes to cells
within a table based on the value in the cell. An example of why
this might be useful is cases where we want to display a short
description of what data in a given cell means.

This has been implemented by adding a new property to the Column
class called the 'cell_attributes_getter'. This attribute is a
callable which returns a dictionary with the html attributes and
their values. The attribute defined in this dictionary can include
any HTML global attributes

Change-Id: I9e9aa1bc32e7afd1a62a69dc13ef0ed0d0e748c4
Implements: blueprint add-attributes-for-table-cells
"}]
commit_message:
Add attributes to cell in a table depending on data

This feature helps users to selectively add attributes to cells
within a table based on the value in the cell. An example of why
this might be useful is cases where we want to display a short
description of what data in a given cell means.

This has been implemented by adding a new property to the Column
class called the 'cell_attributes_getter'. This attribute is a
callable which returns a dictionary with the html attributes and
their values. The attribute defined in this dictionary can include
any HTML global attributes

Change-Id: I9e9aa1bc32e7afd1a62a69dc13ef0ed0d0e748c4
Implements: blueprint add-attributes-for-table-cells

commit_message:
Implement OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments

This is a resource which subclasses ResourceGroup to deploy a group
of OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment resources

The main difference in properties between this resource and
OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment is that it has a 'servers' property
instead of 'server'. The servers property expects a map of
resource-name/nova-uuid pairs. The resource name is used as the
deployment resource name inside the group, and the nova-uuid is used
as the server to deploy to.

The attributes deploy_stdouts, deploy_stderrs, deploy_status_codes
each return a map where the key is the server name and the value
is the respective attribute from the deployment resource.

Change-Id: Ide1e8fb57d45062e5d459b484135a5cad6d2c7dc
Partial-Blueprint: deployment-multiple-servers

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-09-01 00:15:08.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/resource_group.py', 'heat/tests/test_resource_group.py'], 'message': "Provide access to outputs from OS::Heat::ResourceGroup

To align with the related OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup change:
Ib9e830e0c54602ac456d64179e1df30f0778906d

This adds an 'attributes' attribute to the OS::Heat::ResourceGroup resource
so that the following:
  {'get_attr': ['my_asg', 'attributes', 'networks', '<network_name>', 0]}
returns a mapping from resource names to the corresponding IP addresses.

There is no need for an outputs_list attribute since the following already
returns a list:
  {'get_attr': ['my_rg', 'networks', '<network_name>', 0]}

To align ResourceGroup with OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup, there will
be a proposed change to OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup to rename the
following attributes:
- outputs -> attributes
- outputs_list -> attributes_list

Change-Id: Id51f23533ae75ca5d883a4f67e75ac9513a67264
"}]
commit_message:
Provide access to outputs from OS::Heat::ResourceGroup

To align with the related OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup change:
Ib9e830e0c54602ac456d64179e1df30f0778906d

This adds an 'attributes' attribute to the OS::Heat::ResourceGroup resource
so that the following:
  {'get_attr': ['my_asg', 'attributes', 'networks', '<network_name>', 0]}
returns a mapping from resource names to the corresponding IP addresses.

There is no need for an outputs_list attribute since the following already
returns a list:
  {'get_attr': ['my_rg', 'networks', '<network_name>', 0]}

To align ResourceGroup with OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup, there will
be a proposed change to OS::Heat::AutoScalingGroup to rename the
following attributes:
- outputs -> attributes
- outputs_list -> attributes_list

Change-Id: Id51f23533ae75ca5d883a4f67e75ac9513a67264

ResourceGroup make do_prop_replace class method

This refactor allows subclasses to override _do_prop_replace so
that properties can be populated by the specific needs of the subclass.

Partial-Blueprint: deployment-multiple-servers

commit_message:
Fix interface IP address for DVR with gateway

when an interface is added to a router with gateway, the method
internal_network_added(..) incorrectly configures the IP address
of the new snat interface same as the IP address of the new
subnet interface.

Change-Id: I00d4ff1105a443b89b28359249b8e83fb4c1d157
Closes-bug: #1355087

This change has the compute manager's init_instance method check
for a task state set to 'migrating' and resets the task state to

commit_message:
Reset task state 'migrating' on nova compute restart

This change has the compute manager's init_instance method check
for a task state set to 'migrating' and resets the task state to
None, so that live migrations that were pending when the compute
service went down do not result in instances that are perpetually
stuck in 'migrating' task state.

Change-Id: If23ea983cc048f317daae594f420a643f1bfe6ac
Closes-Bug: #1339823

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-02 16:40:23.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/container/test_replicator.py', 'swift/container/replicator.py'], 'message': 'Check for change before container replicator updates db

As described in the related bug report, unnecessary updates
to the container db during replication can impact object
object GET performance in certain circumstances.

This patch changes swift/container/replicator.py so that
calls to merge_timestamps and update_reconciler_sync
are conditional on values having actually changed.

Related-Bug: 1332025
Change-Id: If498251656500ed7a3d7ca4b109ea1079b8513c2
'}]
commit_message:
Check for change before container replicator updates db

As described in the related bug report, unnecessary updates
to the container db during replication can impact object
object GET performance in certain circumstances.

This patch changes swift/container/replicator.py so that
calls to merge_timestamps and update_reconciler_sync
are conditional on values having actually changed.

Related-Bug: 1332025
Change-Id: If498251656500ed7a3d7ca4b109ea1079b8513c2

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-09-02 21:50:21.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/cli.py'], 'message': "Generate IdP Metadata with keystone-manage.

For proper federation setup, an Identity Provider peer needs to
generate metadata that can later be consumed by a federated Service
Provider. Since metadata content doesn't change very often it's
advised to generate a static file and later read its content on demand
(this is out of the scope of this patch). This patch adds required
functionality for utilizing the federation.idp.MetadataGenerator class
from a keystone-manage command line tool. Generated metadata will
be redirected to the stdout.

Change-Id: Ifed1f4e4ede0276b3aba22aa9e236e5e74e2ed93
Implements: bp keystone-to-keystone-federation
"}]
commit_message:
Generate IdP Metadata with keystone-manage.

For proper federation setup, an Identity Provider peer needs to
generate metadata that can later be consumed by a federated Service
Provider. Since metadata content doesn't change very often it's
advised to generate a static file and later read its content on demand
(this is out of the scope of this patch). This patch adds required
functionality for utilizing the federation.idp.MetadataGenerator class
from a keystone-manage command line tool. Generated metadata will
be redirected to the stdout.

Change-Id: Ifed1f4e4ede0276b3aba22aa9e236e5e74e2ed93
Implements: bp keystone-to-keystone-federation

subject: Error limit the right node on object PUT
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-05 18:43:25.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py'], 'message': 'Error limit the right node on object PUT

If any node had an error on object PUT, the proxy would count the
error against the last-connected-to node instead of the one with the
error. Now it counts the error against the right node.

Change-Id: I884eb73cebe0c723473a6d5e390a148fcad0d3ed
'}]
commit_message:
Error limit the right node on object PUT

If any node had an error on object PUT, the proxy would count the
error against the last-connected-to node instead of the one with the
error. Now it counts the error against the right node.

Change-Id: I884eb73cebe0c723473a6d5e390a148fcad0d3ed

commit_message:
Change app.restapi to app.client_manager.session

This is step 1 toward using Keystone client's session.Session as the
primary session/requests interface in OSC.

* Move the session create into ClientManager and rename 'restapi' attribute to 'session'
* Set up ClientManager and session loggers
* Fix container and object command references to restapi/api

Change-Id: I013d81520b336c7a6422cd22c05d1d65655e64f8

commit_message:
Move cli tests into service subdirectories

This commit takes the cli tests and moves them into service specific directories. This is 
done in lieu of using a service decorator to properly tag the test as using a particular
service. This should be less error prone then adding a decorator to each test case. It also
is useful for projects that have more than one cli interface being tested by making the grouping by service more explicit.

Partially implements bp add-service-tags

Change-Id: I54e01ba29fc03beea83f2377f6b6b98f23361f5f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-09-03 20:39:22.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/serialization/jsonutils.py'], 'message': "Check for namedtuple_as_object support before using it

Commit ad248f6658d572f3f4721f804325db754e9c931d introduced the usage of
the namedtuple_as_object kwarg if using simplejson.

However, that kwarg isn't available until simplejson 2.2.0 which is a
problem for anyone running a RHEL/CentOS 6 distribution.

Normally this would not be a big deal since we can bump minimum required
versions but in this case simplejson is an optional runtime dependency
so most projects don't list it in their requirements.txt files.  So if
you are running with simplejson < 2.2.0 (you might not even know it) and
upgrade, things are going to get sad very quick.

Rather than assume people will be at the right level or figure it out,
let's be smarter and just check if the kwarg is available in the version
of simplejson we're using.  If we don't have a new enough version of
simplejson then fallback to using json despite the performance issues
on python 2.6.

This can be removed in Kilo when python 2.6 support is dropped so this
should be short-term workaround that saves some headaches once Juno is
released.

Closes-Bug: #1361230

Change-Id: Iadc2d28a1a0b125a34ed08344673c6b4a8a758e9
"}]
commit_message:
Check for namedtuple_as_object support before using it

Commit ad248f6658d572f3f4721f804325db754e9c931d introduced the usage of
the namedtuple_as_object kwarg if using simplejson.

However, that kwarg isn't available until simplejson 2.2.0 which is a
problem for anyone running a RHEL/CentOS 6 distribution.

Normally this would not be a big deal since we can bump minimum required
versions but in this case simplejson is an optional runtime dependency
so most projects don't list it in their requirements.txt files.  So if
you are running with simplejson < 2.2.0 (you might not even know it) and
upgrade, things are going to get sad very quick.

Rather than assume people will be at the right level or figure it out,
let's be smarter and just check if the kwarg is available in the version
of simplejson we're using.  If we don't have a new enough version of
simplejson then fallback to using json despite the performance issues
on python 2.6.

This can be removed in Kilo when python 2.6 support is dropped so this
should be short-term workaround that saves some headaches once Juno is
released.

Closes-Bug: #1361230

Change-Id: Iadc2d28a1a0b125a34ed08344673c6b4a8a758e9

commit_message:
Routes for Keystone-IdP metadata endpoint

Keystone acting as an Identity Provider should expose an endpoint
where federated peers can access its SAML2 Metadata file.

API spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/118074/

Change-Id: I94d26ce88d2468af71bc1c9d1cba1b422da4480e
Implements: bp keystone-to-keystone-federation

subject: Combine acc/cont put_* methods and fix their lock problem.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 995, 'name': 'David Goetz', 'email': 'david.goetz@rackspace.com', 'username': 'david-goetz'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 2828, 'name': 'Michael Barton', 'email': 'mike@weirdlooking.com', 'username': 'redbo'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-29 18:45:41.000000000', 'files': ['swift/account/backend.py', 'swift/common/db.py', 'swift/container/backend.py'], 'message': "Combine acc/cont put_* methods and fix their lock problem.

The container backend is supposed to build a pending file and,
when it gets to a certain size, flush it all at once into the
sqlite db. Before this fix, many concurrent threads would ask
what the pending file size is to see if they should flush
instead of just appending to the pending file. The problem is
that many would ask, find it's too big, and try to get a lock.
The first one wins, flushes, but all the other waiting threads
still think they have to flush- which is a much slower opertaion
than just the append. This change gets the lock first and makes
sure that merge_items is only called when the pending file is full.

Change-Id: I29cfa13a48c8f7d16dd414b2288d50461adbafd2
"}]
commit_message:
Combine acc/cont put_* methods and fix their lock problem.

The container backend is supposed to build a pending file and,
when it gets to a certain size, flush it all at once into the
sqlite db. Before this fix, many concurrent threads would ask
what the pending file size is to see if they should flush
instead of just appending to the pending file. The problem is
that many would ask, find it's too big, and try to get a lock.
The first one wins, flushes, but all the other waiting threads
still think they have to flush- which is a much slower opertaion
than just the append. This change gets the lock first and makes
sure that merge_items is only called when the pending file is full.

Change-Id: I29cfa13a48c8f7d16dd414b2288d50461adbafd2

subject: Fix last_modified_date_to_timestamp on non-UTC systems
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 330, 'name': 'John Dickinson', 'email': 'me@not.mn', 'username': 'notmyname'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-08-30 01:34:06.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Fix last_modified_date_to_timestamp on non-UTC systems

Before, we were calling datetime.datetime.strftime('%s.%f') to convert
a datetime to epoch seconds + microseconds. However, the '%s' format
isn't actually part of Python's library. Rather, Python passes that on
to the system C library, which is typically glibc. Now, glibc takes
the '%s' format and helpfully* applies the current timezone as an
offset. This gives bogus results on machines where UTC is not the
system timezone. (Yes, some people really do that.)

For example:

    >>> import os
    >>> from swift.common import utils
    >>> os.environ['TZ'] = 'PST8PDT,M3.2.0,M11.1.0'
    >>> float(utils.last_modified_date_to_timestamp('1970-01-01T00:00:00.000000'))
    28800.0
    >>>

That timestamp should obviously be 0.

This patch replaces the strftime() call with datetime arithmetic,
which is entirely in Python so the system timezone doesn't mess it up.

* unhelpfully

Change-Id: I56855acd79a5d8f2c98a771fa9fd2729e4f490b1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix last_modified_date_to_timestamp on non-UTC systems

Before, we were calling datetime.datetime.strftime('%s.%f') to convert
a datetime to epoch seconds + microseconds. However, the '%s' format
isn't actually part of Python's library. Rather, Python passes that on
to the system C library, which is typically glibc. Now, glibc takes
the '%s' format and helpfully* applies the current timezone as an
offset. This gives bogus results on machines where UTC is not the
system timezone. (Yes, some people really do that.)

For example:

    >>> import os
    >>> from swift.common import utils
    >>> os.environ['TZ'] = 'PST8PDT,M3.2.0,M11.1.0'
    >>> float(utils.last_modified_date_to_timestamp('1970-01-01T00:00:00.000000'))
    28800.0
    >>>

That timestamp should obviously be 0.

This patch replaces the strftime() call with datetime arithmetic,
which is entirely in Python so the system timezone doesn't mess it up.

* unhelpfully

Change-Id: I56855acd79a5d8f2c98a771fa9fd2729e4f490b1
